intro: Acetosella bifrons, commonly known as the spring sandwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open areas such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a distinctive, rounded shape. Acetosella bifrons is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring, contributing to the early pollinator activity in its habitat.
